pull_request.title: Presentation: Format point property values with units
pull_request.body:
Added support for formatting point property values with unit on frontend.

Part of https://github.com/iTwin/itwinjs-core/issues/6150

issue.title: Support units formatting for Point properties
issue.body:
At the moment we only support units formatting for numeric type of properties - we should support that point properties as well.

[Example](https://qa-presentationruleseditor.bentley.com/open-imodel?iTwinId=f9eec5fc-3cbe-4ac7-ba82-4ec99474e873&iModelId=22fe29b3-6a1f-4035-8b1b-192889e375ba#-zGZgARjAoMDQQgtngnlttg4Xg4CkVRLBPHVyA1rIgYEsOi5dLETOZLNZBvZHnh8ZCQGtid4okj3BTiKEYH44AEgnl0ThMY9sZ1pXhZU8QE8gA):
![Image](https://github.com/iTwin/presentation/assets/35135765/179810aa-fec6-48c7-8788-e35e1f916428)

In the above picture, [the "Start Point" and "End Point" properties have LENGTH kind of quantity](https://qa-imodelconsole.bentley.com/?projectid=f9eec5fc-3cbe-4ac7-ba82-4ec99474e873&imodelid=22fe29b3-6a1f-4035-8b1b-192889e375ba&changesetid=e96bc522db651aefa5efe3fa4b25839dbd7b8042&=select%20p.name%20PropertyName,%20koq.name%20KoqName%20from%20meta.ECPropertyDef%20p%20left%20join%20meta.KindOfQuantityDef%20koq%20on%20koq.ECInstanceId%20=%20p.KindOfQuantity.id%20where%20p.class.id%20=%200x18b%20and%20p.DisplayLabel%20in%20('Start%20Point',%20'End%20Point')), so they should be formatted accordingly.

```[tasklist]
- [x] Ensure native addon assigns kind of quantity metadata to point properties.
- [x] Support units formatting for point properties in native addon.
- [ ] Support units formatting for point properties in `@itwin/presentation-components` package.
```

Support downloading iModel in iOS test (#6093)
Make persistent reality models display with batched tiles (#6121)

issue.title: KnownLocations.nativeAssetsDir returns a path not compatible with the SchemaXmlFileLocater on Windows

labels.name: ecschema
labels.description: Issues related to the various ecschema packages

comment.body:
Right - thanks. Do you consider that an "us" problem (i.e., we need to somehow escape that valid path before passing it to GlobSync), or a GlobSync problem (i.e., it's not properly handling valid paths)?
Stripping off the `\\?\` won't suffice; without it, the path length is limited to MAX_PATH.

issue.title: KnownLocations.nativeAssetsDir returns a path not compatible with the SchemaXmlFileLocater on Windows

labels.name: ecschema
labels.description: Issues related to the various ecschema packages

comment.body:
Here is an approximate path ... the problem is the way`\\?\` is handled
`\\?\D:\src\app\common\temp\node_modules\.pnpm\@bentley+imodeljs-native@4.2.5\node_modules\@bentley\imodeljs-native\imodeljs-win32-x64\Assets\ECSchemas\Standard`

comment.body: Please provide the **actual** path name returned on your machine by `KnownLocations.nativeAssetsDir`. I assume it is not actually "banana".

Revert "override babel/traverse to specific version"

This reverts commit 75a45abc9f53984904e033e7d96b0ce7c9fa6010.
Update tests to release CoreCustomAttributes EC3.2 schema (#6141)

pull_request.title: Update tests to release CoreCustomAttributes EC3.2 schema
pull_request.body:
CoreCustomAttributes v01.00.04, an EC3.2 schema, is about to be released. To ensure that PR build pipelines can work with the latest schema, some tests and test data need to be modified. This PR introduces the required test changes.
